alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 12 at 8:53PM MDT until April 13 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SIGNIFICANT SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .While temperatures will be much cooler Wednesday, an extremely dry airmass with widespread and long duration single digit relative humidity values will be combined with strong to very strong wind speeds. This will yield critical fire weather conditions areawide below significant snowpack. Strong winds and low relative humidity values will persist on Thursday across northeast New Mexico. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Middle Rio Grande Valley, Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains and the East Central Plains. Critical fire weather conditions are expected from mid morning through mid evening Wednesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph Wednesday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...4 to 8 percent Wednesday. * IMPACTS....Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains
